intro: Microstylis pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf microstylis, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tiny, clustered inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet, swampy habitats and is often found in low-light conditions. Due to its small size and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
